security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Uses Bash tool only to trigger user-provided webhook URLs via curl. Stores workflow documentation in plain text files within its own directory. Security considerations around webhook URL handling are documented and user-controlled.

low_findings.title: Webhook URLs stored in plain text
low_findings.description: The skill stores webhook URLs in plain text files (references/zaps.md). These URLs contain authentication tokens that could trigger Zaps if exposed. The skill explicitly documents this risk at lines 74-90 and provides best practices for mitigation.

content.user_title: Automate Zapier workflows with intelligent memory
content.value_statement: Zapier MCP provides over 8,000 individual tools with no memory of your preferences. This skill gives Claude persistent memory for your workflows so it remembers which tools to use and when. It also triggers your pre-built multi-step Zaps via webhooks with simple conversational requests.
actual_capabilities: Remember and apply user tool preferences across all conversations
Trigger pre-built multi-step Zaps via webhook URLs with simple requests
Document and orchestrate MCP tool sequences for complex workflows
Self-learn and update skill files when users teach new patterns
Provide setup instructions for Zapier MCP and webhook configuration
Detect when MCP tools are missing and guide users through setup
limitations: Requires user to configure Zapier account, MCP tools, and webhook URLs
Only operates within its own directory for file storage and editing
Cannot create new Zaps in Zapier dashboard - only triggers existing ones

use_cases.title: Daily automated briefings
use_cases.description: Trigger pre-built daily digest Zaps with a simple request. Claude remembers your format preferences and delivery methods.

use_cases.title: Research and document workflows
use_cases.description: Use Perplexity for research and automatically save results to Google Sheets. Claude remembers your sheet names and data formats.

use_cases.title: Lead tracking automation
use_cases.description: Document lead capture preferences. Claude orchestrates multiple MCP tools to process and track leads according to your rules.

prompt_templates.title: Research topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Research the latest developments in artificial intelligence and save the key findings to my research sheet

prompt_templates.title: Log expenses
prompt_templates.prompt: Log this expense: 45.00 for office supplies at Staples

prompt_templates.title: Add new Zap
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add a new webhook-triggered Zap for weekly team reports. The webhook URL is https://hooks.zapier.com/hooks/catch/123456/abcdef. It sends a summary email every Friday. Trigger phrase: weekly team report

output: Started your Daily AI Digest. You will receive the summary report via email in approximately 3 minutes. High-priority items will include SMS alerts.

best_practices: Install the skill globally at ~/.claude/skills/ so learned patterns persist across all projects
Add .claude/ to your .gitignore to prevent accidentally committing webhook URLs
Regenerate webhook URLs immediately if accidentally exposed and update your skill files
anti_patterns: Do not commit skill files with real webhook URLs to public repositories
Do not share skill files without replacing actual URLs with placeholder examples
Do not skip documenting your tool preferences - undocumented tools have no context

faq.question: What tools do I need before using this skill?
faq.answer: You need Claude Code and a Zapier account. For MCP tools, visit mcp.zapier.com to connect them. For webhook Zaps, create Zaps in Zapier dashboard with Webhooks trigger.

faq.question: How many workflows can this skill manage?
faq.answer: Unlimited. The skill stores all workflow documentation in text files within its directory. Each new Zap or pattern is added as the user defines them.

faq.question: Can I use this skill without Zapier MCP?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works independently with webhooks only, MCP tools only, or both combined. Each mode provides value without the other.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill only reads and writes files within its own directory. Webhook URLs you store are not sent anywhere except to your configured Zapier endpoints that you provide.

faq.question: Why is my Zap not triggering?
faq.answer: Common causes: Zap is turned off in Zapier dashboard, webhook URL was copied incorrectly, wrong trigger type (must be Catch Hook), or network firewall blocking curl requests.

faq.question: How is this different from using Zapier MCP directly?
faq.answer: Zapier MCP gives access to 8,000 individual actions but has no memory. This skill provides persistent memory so Claude remembers your preferences, which tools to use when, and can trigger your complex multi-step Zaps through webhooks.
